meanings.definition: A loose-fitting hooded robe worn in Arab countries.
meanings.sent1: The children wore colorful djellabahs during the festival.
meanings.sent2: In the market, you can find various styles of djellabahs.
meanings.sent3: The djellabahs looked like magical cloaks fluttering in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of djellabahs transformed her wardrobe into a cultural treasure trove.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the djellabahs enveloped him in comfort and warmth.

meanings.definition: The plural form of djellabah, a traditional North African garment.
meanings.sent1: She packed her suitcase with colorful djellabahs for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The shop displayed a variety of djellabahs in different sizes.
meanings.sent3: The djellabahs hanging on the line swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors of the djellabahs brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The intricate embroidery on the djellabahs showcased skilled craftsmanship.
